supporting_text: The NAP adopts a One Health approach by integrating human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to address AMR in the animal health sector.
The NAP includes strategies that focus on environmental factors contributing to AMR.
The NAP addresses agricultural practices and food security in relation to AMR.
The NAP specifies mechanisms for regular progress reporting on its objectives.
The NAP sets specific, time-bound targets for monitoring progress.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for various AMR-related strategies.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for its activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral committee to coordinate AMR efforts.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen the legislative framework for AMR.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR.
The NAP includes public awareness campaigns to combat AMR.
The NAP emphasizes international collaboration for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes strategies for data collection and analysis for AMR surveillance.
The NAP includes actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP outlines specific prevention strategies including sanitation and IPC measures.
The NAP includes actions to implement international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP includes regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes participation in international research collaborations for new medicines and tools.
